law.catch_line: Access fees -- Agreement with Legislative Research Commission required prior to access.

text.section: For the services rendered in providing access to the legislative electronic information system, the Legislative Research Commission may charge and collect fees as it determines, which shall be a reasonable and sufficient proportion of the costs for maintaining the system and furnishing access. No fee shall be charged to legislative users, including individual legislators.

No person, organization, corporation, or other entity shall receive access to legislative computer information, nor receive related services including the copying of computerized information, without first applying to the Legislative Research Commission and entering into an agreement with the Legislative Research Commission to provide such access or services.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 66, effective July 13, 1990.
